meanings.sent1: The young plants were susceptive to the sunlight, growing quickly in its warmth.
meanings.sent2: The new student was susceptive to the teacher's guidance, eager to learn.
meanings.sent3: The empty cup seemed susceptive, waiting to be filled with refreshing water.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a susceptive sponge, absorbing every detail of the story.
meanings.sent5: The soil was susceptive to the seeds, nurturing them into vibrant flowers.

meanings.definition: Having the capacity to undergo or experience.
meanings.sent1: The adventurous explorer was susceptive to new challenges, always seeking excitement.
meanings.sent2: The curious child was susceptive to new ideas, eager to explore the world.
meanings.sent3: The old car appeared susceptive, ready for one last thrilling road trip.
meanings.sent4: His heart was susceptive to love, open to the possibility of a deep connection.
meanings.sent5: The artist's mind was susceptive to inspiration, creating beautiful masterpieces.
